page.title: 06 TRANSPORT (1)
page.content:
From our survey we found out that 51% of people have two or more cars. Everybody has one car, although a few elderly folk not covered by our survey are without personal transport. The isolated nature of our area increases our reliance on the motor car.
Less than 20% of those surveyed work in the local community (and a half of these represent second wage- earners); a further 27% work in the St.Neots and Huntingdon areas; 24% go to Bedford and Cambridge, and 29% travel as far afield as London and other more distant parts of the country. Once the new Category 'C' Prison opens in 1986 at the former Gaynes Hall Borstal site, the area is likely to attract a more local workforce.
